revision.text:
{{Infobox person | years_active = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1962|6|13|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Queens]], [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], [[United States|U.S.]] | occupation = Comedian, actor | name = Alonzo Bodden }} '''Alonzo Bodden''' ({{IPAc-en|ə|ˈ|l|ɒ|n|z|oʊ|_|ˈ|b|oʊ|d|ən}}; born June 13, 1962) is an American [[comedian]] and [[actor]] known for winning the grand prize in the third season of the [[reality television|reality-television]] series ''[[Last Comic Standing]]''. He had been the [[runner-up]] in the previous season.
In 2007, he released his [[DVD]] ''Tall, Dark and Funny''. He was a talent judge in [[NBC]]'s [[Last Comic Standing 5|5th season of ''Last Comic Standing'']], along with [[Kathleen Madigan]] and [[Ant (comedian)|ANT]]. He is also a television host and voice-over actor.
==Early life== Alonzo Bodden was born and raised in the Saint Albans area of Queens, New York. His mother was African American while his father was black Honduran.{{citation needed|date=December 2016}}
Before his work in show business, Bodden worked for [[Lockheed Martin]] and McDonnell Douglas in Long Beach in the training department in the early 90's.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.shayne-michael.com/links.php?searchFor=Alonzo%20Bodden&findBio=full|title=The Alonzo Bodden Biography @ Shayne-Michael.COMedy|last=Michael|first=Shayne|website=www.shayne-michael.com|access-date=2017-11-04}}</ref>
==Television== He hosted<ref name="acp">[[The Adam Carolla Podcast]], 3/11/2009</ref> the [[Speed TV]] program ''[[101 Cars You Must Drive]]''. He is also a host for ''[[America's Worst Driver]]''. He also guest starred on ''[[Angel (1999 TV series)|Angel]]''.
He has performed on numerous television shows including ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'', ''[[Make Me Laugh]]'', ''[[Late Friday]]'', ''[[The Late Late Show (CBS TV series)|The Late Late Show with Craig Kilborn]]'', ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'' and ''[[It's Showtime at the Apollo]]''. He is also a [[voice actor]] who has worked on ''[[Power Rangers: Lightspeed Rescue]]'', ''[[Masked Rider (TV series)|Masked Rider]]'', and ''[[O'Grady]]''.
He is a co-host of ''[[Inside the Vault]]'' on [[WGN America]].
In 2011, he was a panelist on a [[BBC America]] year end special of ''[[Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!]]'', as well as a recurring panelist currently on the weekly NPR show and podcast.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bbcamerica.com/wait-wait-dont-tell-me/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-11-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120810204334/http://www.bbcamerica.com/wait-wait-dont-tell-me/ |archivedate=2012-08-10 |df= }}</ref>
During 2014, he was a comedic panelist on [[Game Show Network]]'s original series ''[[Mind of a Man]]''.
==Filmography<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0090785/|title=Alonzo Bodden|website=IMDb|access-date=2017-11-04}}</ref>==
===Movies=== * ''[[8 Guys]]'' (2003) ([[short film]]) * ''[[Bringing Down the House (film)|Bringing Down the House]]'' (2003) * ''[[The Girl Next Door (2004 film)|The Girl Next Door]]'' (2004) * ''[[Scary Movie 4]]'' (2006) * ''[[National Lampoon's Totally Baked: A Potumentary]]'' (2007) * ''[[Why We Ride]]'' (2013)
===Television=== * ''[[Californication (TV series)|Californication]]'' (2014) * [[America's Worst Driver]] (2010) * [[Angel (1999 TV series)|Angel]] (2003) – Eddie Rhodes
===Voice-over=== *''[[Masked Rider (TV series)|Masked Rider]]'' – Ultivore (voice) *''[[Power Rangers: Lightspeed Rescue]]'' – Thunderon (voice)
==Radio== Bodden frequently appears as a panelist on NPR's news quiz show ''[[Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2010/12/07/110997511/about-the-panelists|title=About The Panelists|website=NPR.org}}</ref> as a guest on [[The Joe Rogan Experience]] and on ''[[The Adam Carolla Show (radio)|The Adam Carolla Show]]''.
==Personal life== Bodden is a car and motorcycle enthusiast. In addition to an e92 [[BMW M3]] and JCW Mini Cooper, Bodden owns many motorcycles, including a [[Triumph Rocket III]], a [[Triumph Speed Triple]], a [[Ducati 1098]], a [[BMW HP2]], and a [[Ducati Multistrada]], and formerly owned a [[Honda CB400F]].<ref name="acp" /><ref name="hfl" /> In 2010, Bodden [[Highsider|highsided]] his Ducati 1098 while racing at [[Buttonwillow Raceway Park]]. The crash shattered his [[scaphoid]], requiring surgeries and a bone graft to fix.<ref name="acs">[[The Adam Carolla Show (podcast)]], [http://www.adamcarolla.com/ACPBlog/2010/07/27/alonzo-bodden/ July 27, 2010] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100830015821/http://www.adamcarolla.com/ACPBlog/2010/07/27/alonzo-bodden/ |date=August 30, 2010 }}</ref> In 2011, he had customizer Nick Anglada rebuild the bike in a bare aluminum and anodized gold palette.<ref name="hfl">{{cite news|url=http://hellforleathermagazine.com/2011/05/custom-alonzo-boddens-1098/|title=Custom: Alonzo Bodden’s 1098|last=Smith|first=Sean|date=27 May 2011|work=[[Hell for Leather]]|accessdate=28 May 2011}}</ref>
March 26, 2013 Bodden donated a kidney to his brother, who is three years older.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.rsnhope.org/kidneytalk/laughing-your-way-to-living-donation/|title=Laughing Your Way to Living Donation {{!}} Renal Support Network|date=2014-12-16|work=Renal Support Network|access-date=2017-11-04|language=en-US}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
